alert.note: Alert for Clay; Harlan; Knott; Leslie; Letcher; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 8:17PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Harlan, Leslie, Letcher, southeastern Perry, southwestern Knott and east central Clay Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 817 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Hazard to Plank. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hazard, Diablock, Frew and Avawam around 825 PM EDT. Jeff around 830 PM EDT. Viper, Wiscoal and Anco around 835 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Vicco, Sassafras, Essie, Cornettsville, Daisy, Asher, Red Star, Bluefield, Arminta, Ulvah, Warbranch, Gander, Carcassonne, Mozelle, Slemp, Letcher, Blackey, Spruce Pine, Elko, Hallie, Indian Bottom, David, Carbon Glow, Jeremiah, Chappell, Harlan, Cumberland, Loyall, Roxana, Lilley Cornett Woods, Skyline, Banks, Premium, Hot Spot and Bledsoe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for southeastern Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Harlan; Knott; Leslie; Letcher; Perry
